revision.text:
{{Infobox film | name = Goyo: Ang Batang Heneral | image = Goyo Ang Batang Heneral poster.jpg | caption = Theatrical release poster | director = [[Jerrold Tarog]] | producer = {{Plainlist| *Joe Alandy *Daphne O. Chiu }} | writer = {{Plainlist| *Jerrold Tarog *Rody Vera<ref name="begins"/> }} | starring = {{Plainlist| *[[Paulo Avelino]] *[[Carlo Aquino]] *Mon Confiado *[[Epy Quizon]] *[[Gwen Zamora]] *[[Empress Schuck]] *[[Alvin Anson]] *Rafa Siguion-Reyna }} | music = Jerrold Tarog | cinematography = Pong Ignacio | editing = Jerrold Tarog | production companies = {{Plainlist| *[[TBA Studios]] *Artikulo Uno Productions *[[Globe Studios]]<ref>{{cite web |last1=Adel |first1=Rosette |title=WATCH: Official 'Goyo' trailer out |url=https://www.philstar.com/entertainment/2018/08/05/1839895/watch-official-goyo-trailer-out |website=The Philippine Star |date=August 5, 2018 |accessdate=September 1, 2018}}</ref> }} | released = {{Film date|mf=yes|2018|9|5}} | runtime = | country = Philippines | language = [[Filipino language|Filipino]] | budget = | gross = }}
'''''Goyo: Ang Batang Heneral''''' (English: ''Goyo: The Boy General''<!-- It's 'Boy General' per the Gregorio del Pilar article's introductory paragraph -->), also known simply as '''''Goyo''''',{{refn|<ref name="pepcast"/><ref name="abscbncast">{{cite news|title=Meet the stars of ''Heneral Luna'' sequel ''Goyo''|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/entertainment/05/18/17/meet-the-stars-of-heneral-luna-sequel-goyo|accessdate=August 22, 2017|work=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs]]|date=May 18, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170725214830/http://news.abs-cbn.com/entertainment/05/18/17/meet-the-stars-of-heneral-luna-sequel-goyo|archivedate=July 25, 2017|df=}}</ref>}} is a 2018 Philippine [[historical period drama|historical]] [[epic film]] starring [[Paulo Avelino]] as the titular [[Gregorio del Pilar|Gregorio "Goyo" del Pilar]], one of the youngest Generals during the [[Philippine–American War]] who died at the historic [[Battle of Tirad Pass]]. It is written, directed, edited, and scored by [[Jerrold Tarog]], and is a sequel to the critically and commercially successful 2015 film ''[[Heneral Luna]]'', which chronicled [[Antonio Luna]]'s life.<ref name="pepcast"/> Additional members of the ensemble cast include [[Carlo Aquino]], Mon Confiado, [[Epy Quizon]], [[Gwen Zamora]], [[Empress Schuck]], [[Alvin Anson]], and Rafa Siguion-Reyna. It was released on September 5, 2018.
==Plot== Following the assassination of General [[Antonio Luna]], the task of purging Luna's loyalists in the Philippine Army falls to General [[Gregorio del Pilar|Gregorio "Goyo" del Pilar]], a young, brash general and a favorite of President [[Emilio Aguinaldo]]. During a five-month break from combat, del Pilar and his unit, including his older brother Julian and his best friend Vicente Enriquez, capture Angel Bernal, the younger brother of Luna's former aides-de-camp, Manuel and José. They soon locate Manuel hiding with merchant Don Mariano Nable José and torture him into joining del Pilar's military personnel. When Manuel refuses, they kill him. Meanwhile, Joven Hernando, who now works for his uncle, is assigned to be del Pilar's photographer.
While the Philippine Army relaxes and the American forces prepare for a second attack, General [[Jose Alejandrino|José Alejandrino]], a Luna ally spared from the purge, meets with [[Apolinario Mabini]], who has since resigned from Aguinaldo's cabinet after the death of Luna. Mabini implores Alejandrino to find out the real cause of Luna's death. Meanwhile, Aguinaldo joins del Pilar in [[Bulacan]] and promotes him to Major-General of [[Pangasinan]], while del Pilar begins to court Remedios, the elusive daughter of Don Mariano. During his time, Aguinaldo meets Mabini and offers him the post of Chief Justice, to which Mabini reluctantly accepts.
Alejandrino travels to Manila to negotiate with General [[Elwell Otis]] and General [[Arthur MacArthur Jr.]], who reject his proposal. Soon after, hostilities resume and the Filipino side is caught off-guard. Aguinaldo orders the march of the Army to [[Pozorrubio, Pangasinan|Pozorrubio]] to meet with General [[Manuel Tinio]] and organize a fighting force. However, Tinio was defeated by the Americans, forcing Aguinaldo to retreat further north. The hard march, coupled with daily American attacks, the pressure of having to escort Aguinaldo's family and tensions between soldiers of Luna's old unit take a toll on del Pilar, leading him to ignore an American attack that wipes out their [[rearguard]] and captures Aguinaldo's mother and son.
The group soon arrive at [[Mount Tirad]], where del Pilar [[Battle of Tirad Pass|devises a delaying strategy]] to buy Aguinaldo time to escape. Together with former [[Luna Sharpshooters|Luna Sharpshooter]] Lieutenant García, fortified trenches were dug along the route of the mountain. The following day, the Americans quickly capture a town at the foot of the mountain but are initially unable to penetrate the defenses. They soon find a route around the mountain, appearing behind the trenches, and the Filipinos are quickly overrun. Del Pilar, inspired by a vision induced by his [[PTSD]], resolves to finish the fight, but is shot and killed by an American sniper. As a result, his army's morale breaks and the defenders quickly surrender, with Aguinaldo being forced to flee. Joven and Kiko, Garcia's son, also flee, but Joven falls off a cliff after an encounter with an American soldier. The Americans strip del Pilar of his uniform and belongings and crudely bury him at Mount Tirad.
Aguinaldo is captured by the Americans in [[Palanan, Isabela]] on March 23, 1901, effectively ending the war. Held as a [[prisoner of war]] in [[Malacañang Palace]], he is visited by his former aide-de-camp [[Manuel Quezon]]. Quezon surrendered to the Americans upon orders of his superior, General [[Tomás Mascardo]], to be able to visit Aguinaldo to verify his capture and consult whether Mascardo should surrender. Aguinaldo instructed Quezon that the decision for Mascardo to surrender is up to Mascardo himself.
Mabini is also captured by the Americans and exiled to [[Guam]] where he pens his own narrative of the war entitled ''La Revolución Filipina'' (The Philippine Revolution). General Alejandrino's position is also overrun. Remedios receives a letter from del Pilar.
In a series of mid-credit scenes, Joven is rescued by Kiko and Eduardo Rusca, Luna's former aide; Aguinaldo in 1935 and his running mate, Raymundo Melliza, watch as his [[Philippine presidential election, 1935|presidential campaign]] posters are replaced by those of Quezon.
==Cast== {{colbegin}} *[[Paulo Avelino]] as General [[Gregorio del Pilar]]<ref name="spotph">{{cite news|last1=Dacanay|first1=Aimee|title=Meet the cast of the Paulo Avelino-starrer ''Goyo: Ang Batang Heneral''|url=http://www.spot.ph/entertainment/movies-music-tv/70203/cast-goyo-ang-batang-heneral-a00001-20170518|accessdate=August 22, 2017|work=Spot.ph|publisher=[[Summit Media]]|date=May 18, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170822154940/http://www.spot.ph/entertainment/movies-music-tv/70203/cast-goyo-ang-batang-heneral-a00001-20170518|archivedate=August 22, 2017|df=}}</ref> *[[Carlo Aquino]] as Colonel Vicente Enríquez<ref name="hawson"/> *[[Arron Villaflor]] as Joven Hernándo<ref name="hawson"/> *Mon Confiado as President [[Emilio Aguinaldo]]<ref name="spotph"/> *[[Epy Quizon]] as [[Apolinario Mabini]]<ref name="spotph"/> *[[Alvin Anson]] as General [[José Alejandrino]]<ref name="spotph"/> *[[Gwen Zamora]] as Remedios Nable José<ref name="spot"/> *[[Empress Schuck]] as Felicidad Aguinaldo<ref name="hawson"/> *[[Che Ramos|Che Ramos-Cosio]] as [[Hilaria Aguinaldo]]<ref name="hawson"/> *Rafa Siguion-Reyna as Colonel Julián del Pilar<ref name="hawson"/> *Art Acuña as Major Manuel Bernal<ref name="hawson"/> *Tomas Santos as Angelito<ref name="spot"/> *Robert Seña as Don Mariano Nable José<ref name="hawson"/> *[[Ronnie Lazaro]] as Lieutenant Pantaleon García<ref name="hawson"/> *Jojit Lorenzo as Miguel Laureáno<ref name="hawson"/> *[[Matt Evans]] as Lieutenant Telesforo Carrasco<ref name="hawson"/> *[[Benjamin Alves]] as Lieutenant [[Manuel L. Quezon]]<ref name="spotph"/> **[[TJ Trinidad]] as Manuel L. Quezon (1935)<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.pep.ph/pepalerts/cabinet-files/22850/millennials-hindi-kilala-kung-sino-si-goyo |title=Millennials, Hindi Kilala Kung Sino si Goyo? |last=Gabinete |first=Jojo |date=August 31, 2018 |website=[[Philippine Entertainment Portal]] |publisher= |language=Filipino |trans-title=Millenials Unaware of Who Goyo Is |access-date=September 27, 2018}}</ref> *[[Leo Martinez]] as [[Pedro Paterno]]<ref name="spotph"/> *[[Perla Bautista]] as Doña Trinidad Aguinaldo<ref name="hawson"/> *Roeder Camañag as Major Evaristo Ortíz<ref name="hawson"/> *E.{{nbsp}}A. Rocha as General [[Elwell Otis]]<ref name="hawson"/> *Miguel Faustmann as General [[Arthur MacArthur Jr.|Arthur MacArthur]]<ref name="hawson"/> *[[Nonie Buencamino]] as Felipe Buencamino Sr.<ref name="pepcast" /> {{colend}}
Other members of the [[ensemble cast]] are Christopher Aronson, [[RK Bagatsing]], Carlo Cruz, Jason Dewey, [[Bret Jackson]], Ethan Salvador, Lorenz Martinez, Karl Medina, [[Stephanie Sol]], and [[Markki Stroem]].<ref name="pepcast">{{cite news|title=Who will join Paulo Avelino in ''Goyo: Ang Batang Heneral''?|url=http://www.pep.ph/guide/movies/26082/who-will-join-paulo-avelino-in-emgoyo-ang-batang-heneralem|accessdate=August 22, 2017|work=[[Philippine Entertainment Portal]]|date=May 18, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170822154941/http://www.pep.ph/guide/movies/26082/who-will-join-paulo-avelino-in-emgoyo-ang-batang-heneralem|archivedate=August 22, 2017|df=}}</ref>
==Production== Plans for a sequel to [[Jerrold Tarog]]'s ''[[Heneral Luna]]'' went underway after its critical and commercial success.<ref name="luna"/> Tarog envisioned the sequel as being about [[Gregorio del Pilar]], a young General who, like ''Heneral Luna''{{'}}s titular protagonist [[Antonio Luna]], was among the Filipino historical figures during the [[Philippine–American War]]. Accordingly, [[Paulo Avelino]], who played Del Pilar in ''Luna'', came aboard to reprise his role.<ref name="luna">{{cite news|title=Watch: After ''Heneral Luna'', a movie on Gregorio del Pilar is in the works, Paulo Avelino to star|url=http://www.rappler.com/entertainment/movies/111127-heneral-luna-gregorio-del-pilar-movie-paulo-avelino|accessdate=August 22, 2017|work=[[Rappler]]|date=October 29, 2015|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160916040832/http://www.rappler.com/entertainment/movies/111127-heneral-luna-gregorio-del-pilar-movie-paulo-avelino|archivedate=September 16, 2016|df=}}</ref>
Tarog's research for ''Goyo'' involved studying biographies authored by [[Teodoro Kalaw]] as well as crossing the [[Tirad Pass]].<ref name="begins">{{cite news|last1=San Diego Jr.|first1=Bayani|title=''Goyo'' begins|url=http://entertainment.inquirer.net/233852/goyo-begins|accessdate=August 22, 2017|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=July 11, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170822154940/http://entertainment.inquirer.net/233852/goyo-begins|archivedate=August 22, 2017|df=}}</ref> Tarog again incorporated several prominent Filipino figures including the likes of [[Apolinario Mabini]] and [[Emilio Aguinaldo]], aiming for a scope larger than what was present in ''Heneral Luna''. Tarog co-wrote the film's screenplay with Rody Vera, who has said he had thoroughly studied ''Luna'' "to understand the flow of the conversations and other details unique to each character".<ref name="begins"/>
''Goyo'' entered [[pre-production]] in January 2017.<ref name=wethepvblic>{{cite news|title=Look: ''Goyo: Ang Batang Heneral'' is in pre-production |url=http://wethepvblic.com/look-goyo-ang-batang-heneral-pre-production/#.WOsTKzuGOHs |accessdate=April 10, 2017 |work=We The Pvblic |date=January 16, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170410133054/http://wethepvblic.com/look-goyo-ang-batang-heneral-pre-production/ |archivedate=April 10, 2017}}</ref> To prepare his scenes, Avelino underwent [[horseback riding]] lessons in March 2017.<ref name="begins"/> Tarog projected a 50-day film shoot,<ref>{{cite news|last1=Cabato |first1=Regine |title=''Bliss'' director hopes audiences reflect on abuse |url=http://cnnphilippines.com/lifestyle/2017/05/11/jerrold-tarog-bliss-abuse.html |accessdate=May 12, 2017 |publisher=[[CNN Philippines]] |date=May 11, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170512170556/http://cnnphilippines.com/lifestyle/2017/05/11/jerrold-tarog-bliss-abuse.html |archivedate=May 12, 2017 }}</ref> which began in May 2017.<ref>{{cite tweet |author= [[Jerrold Tarog|Tarog, Jerrold]] |user= JerroldTarog |number=884614889918021632 |date= July 10, 2017 |title='Goyo' begins http://entertainment.inquirer.net/233852/goyo-begins … @inquirerdotnet (Technically, we've been shooting since May but okay) |access-date=August 22, 2017 }}</ref> The complete [[ensemble cast]] was also revealed in a photo taken during the May shoot, including the likes of Mon Confiado as Emilio Aguinaldo, [[Epy Quizon]] as Apolinario Mabini, [[Benjamin Alves]] as [[Manuel L. Quezon]], [[Leo Martinez]] as [[Pedro Paterno]], and [[Alvin Anson]] as [[José Alejandrino]], reprising their roles from ''Heneral Luna''.<ref name="spotph"/> Filming [[wrap (filmmaking)|wrapped]] on November 27, 2017, lasting 60 days.<ref>{{Cite tweet |user=JerroldTarog |author=Jerrold Tarog |number=934810130503278593 |date = November 27, 2017 |title=I can honestly say that I never thought I'd experience something like that in my life. 60 shooting days over 7 months, huge sets, mountain battles through rain, sun, fog, mud. Holy crap. Immense gratitude & respect to the GOYO cast & crew. Proud of you guys. And that's a wrap!|accessdate=December 1, 2017 }}</ref> The production cost for the film is said to be triple the budget of ''Luna''.<ref name="hawson"/>
==Release== On February 15, 2017, a 20-minute [[short film]] entitled ''Angelito'' was exclusively released during the theatrical premiere of ''[[I'm Drunk, I Love You]]'' to serve as a prelude to ''Goyo'' and to intertwine both the sequel and ''Heneral Luna''.<ref>{{cite news|title=''Gregorio del Pilar'' short film to hit theaters with ''I'm Drunk I Love You''|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/entertainment/02/07/17/gregorio-del-pilar-short-film-to-hit-theaters-with-im-drunk-i-love-you|accessdate=August 22, 2017|work=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs]]|date=February 7, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170222195035/http://news.abs-cbn.com/entertainment/02/07/17/gregorio-del-pilar-short-film-to-hit-theaters-with-im-drunk-i-love-you|archivedate=February 22, 2017|df=}}</ref> The film's teaser trailer was released on September 9, 2017.<ref>{{cite news|title=WATCH: First teaser for ''Goyo: Ang Batang Heneral'' will give you goosebumps|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/entertainment/09/09/17/watch-first-teaser-for-goyo-ang-batang-heneral-will-give-you-goosebumps|accessdate=September 9, 2017|work=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs]]|date=September 9, 2017}}</ref> In May 2018, it was announced that the film would be released on September 5, 2018.<ref name="reldate">{{cite news|title='Goyo: Ang Batang Heneral' now has a release date|url=https://www.rappler.com/entertainment/news/201596-goyo-ang-batang-heneral-release-date|accessdate=May 2, 2018|website=Rappler|date=May 2, 2018}}</ref>
==Critical reception== The film received praise for its acting, cinematography, music, and set design,<ref name="hawson">{{cite web |last1=Hawson |first1=Fred |title=Movie review: Subdued but powerful 'Goyo' delivers timely message |url=https://news.abs-cbn.com/life/08/31/18/movie-review-subdued-but-powerful-goyo-delivers-timely-message |website=ABS-CBN News |date=August 31, 2018 |accessdate=September 5, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180914061626/https://news.abs-cbn.com/life/08/31/18/movie-review-subdued-but-powerful-goyo-delivers-timely-message |archive-date=September 14, 2018 |deadurl=no}}</ref><ref name="escobar">{{cite web |last1=Escobar |first1=Miguel |title='Goyo' is a Somber Sequel That is a Spectacular Indictment of Idolatry |url=https://www.esquiremag.ph/culture/arts-and-entertainment/goyo-ang-batang-heneral-review-a00207-20180831 |website=Esquire |location=Philippines |date=August 31, 2018 |accessdate=September 14, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180914140547/https://www.esquiremag.ph/culture/arts-and-entertainment/goyo-ang-batang-heneral-review-a00207-20180831 |archive-date=September 14, 2018 |deadurl=no}}</ref> which Zach Yonzon in [[Spot.PH]] highlighted as "some of the best in Philippine cinema".<ref name="spot">{{cite web |last1=Yonzon |first1=Zach |title=''Goyo: Ang Batang Heneral'' Is a Slow But Masterful Follow-Up to Heneral Luna |url=https://www.spot.ph/entertainment/movies-music-tv/74960/movie-review-goyo-ang-batang-heneral-a1869-20180831-lfrm |website=Spot.PH |publisher=Summit Media |date=August 31, 2018 |accessdate=September 5, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180914061935/https://www.spot.ph/entertainment/movies-music-tv/74960/movie-review-goyo-ang-batang-heneral-a1869-20180831-lfrm |archive-date=September 14, 2018 |deadurl=no}}</ref> Yonzon also gave it a score of 3 out of 5, considering ''Goyo'' to be "masterfully done" though somewhat preposterously made.<ref name="spot"/> Writing for the Philippine edition of ''[[Esquire (magazine)|Esquire]]'', Miguel Escobar called the film captivating: "It's a slow burn through the first half, but it's never boring and always beautiful."<ref name="escobar"/> Fred Hawson of [[ABS-CBN News]] called it "subdued but powerful" and gave a score of 9 out of 10.<ref name="hawson"/>
==Sequel== It was reported that the sequel to ''Goyo'' would revolve around [[President of the Philippines|President]] [[Manuel L. Quezon]]; as such, [[Benjamin Alves]] is set to reprise his role as Quezon.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Deveza |first1=Reyma |title=Benjamin Alves to play Manuel L. Quezon in upcoming movie |url=https://news.abs-cbn.com/entertainment/08/25/18/benjamin-alves-to-play-manuel-l-quezon-in-upcoming-movie |website=ABS-CBN News |date=August 25, 2018 |accessdate=September 15, 2018}}</ref>
==See also== * ''[[Sakay (film)|Sakay]]'' (1993) * ''[[Tirad Pass: The Last Stand of Gen. Gregorio del Pilar]]'' (1996) * ''[[José Rizal (film)|José Rizal]]'' (1998) * ''[[Amigo (film)|Amigo]]'' (2010) * ''[[El Presidente (film)|El Presidente]]'' (2012) * ''[[Bonifacio: Ang Unang Pangulo]]'' (2014) <!-- Please don't add links already cited elsewhere in the article -->
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
==External links== *{{official|http://goyo.ph/}} *{{IMDb title|8443480}} *{{Rotten Tomatoes|id=goyo_the_boy_general|title=Goyo: Ang Batang Heneral}}

[[Ireland]]
[[Australia]]
[[Denmark]]
[[Sweden]]
[[Norway]]
[[Finland]]
[[Canada]] |headquarters = |web = {{URL|http://www.hayu.com}} }} '''Hayu''' (stylized as '''hayu.''' and pronounced '''"hey U"'''){{cite web|title=Hayu|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dsOZ5eEqwus&ab_channel=AdNewsAustralia|website=www.youtube.com|accessdate=27 January 2018|date=25 February 2016}} is a subscription-based video streaming service available in [[United Kingdom]], [[Ireland]], [[Australia]], [[Denmark]], [[Sweden]], [[Norway]], [[Finland]] and [[Canada]]. It was launched in 2016 and it is owned by [[NBCUniversal]]. The service features on demand [[reality television]].{{cite web|last1=Barraclough|first1=Leo|title=NBCUniversal Launches Reality Streaming Service hayu in U.K., Ireland, Australia|url=https://variety.com/2016/digital/global/nbcuniversal-reality-streaming-service-hayu-uk-ireland-australia-1201703166/|website=Variety|accessdate=20 January 2018|date=11 February 2016}}{{cite web|last1=Rigg|first1=Jamie|title=Reality TV streaming service Hayu launches in the UK|url=https://www.engadget.com/2016/03/01/nbcuniversal-hayu-reality-tv/|website=Engadget|accessdate=20 January 2018}} The service also allows viewers to watch programming on the same day that it is released in the [[United States]]. ==Programming== * [[Keeping Up with the Kardashians]] * [[The Real Housewives]] * [[Million Dollar Listing]] * [[Top Chef]] * [[I Am Cait]] * [[Made in Chelsea]] * [[Flipping Out]] * [[Shahs of Sunset]] * [[The Millionaire Matchmaker]] * [[Bad Girls Club]] * [[Don't Tell The Bride]] * [[Below Deck]] * [[Vanderpump Rules]] * [[Jersey Shore (TV series)|Jersey Shore]] * [[Laguna Beach: The Real Orange County]] * [[Rich Kids of Beverly Hills]] * [[Pretty Wild]] * [[Dance Moms]] ==Availability== hayu is available to watch on mobile, tablet, web and connected smart TV through the hayu website, Apple and Android mobile (and tablet), [[Now TV (Sky plc)|Now TV]] and Amazon Fire TV.{{cite web|last1=Griffiths|first1=Josie|title=Here's how to watch the Victoria's Secret show with streaming service hayu|url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/fabulous/2332669/hayu-reality-shows-victoria-secret-download/|website=The Sun|accessdate=20 January 2018|date=29 November 2017}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{Official website|http://www.hayu.com}} {{NBCUniversal}} {{Tv-tech-stub}} [[Category:Video on demand services]] [[Category:iOS software]] [[Category:NBCUniversal]] [[Category:Android (operating system) software]] [[Category:Internet properties established in 2016]] [[Category:Entertainment websites]]

{{Other uses|Hellcat (disambiguation){{!}}Hellcat}} {{good article}} {{Infobox television | show_name = Hellcats | image = Hellcatstitlecard.png | alt = A black background with the word "Hellcats" written and centered | caption = ''Hellcats'' title card | creator = [[Kevin Murphy (screenwriter)|Kevin Murphy]] | starring = {{Plain list| * [[Aly Michalka]] * [[Ashley Tisdale]] * [[Heather Hemmens]] * [[Robbie Jones (actor)|Robbie Jones]] * [[Matt Barr]] * [[Sharon Leal]] * [[Gail O'Grady]] }} | opentheme = "Belong Here" by [[78violet]] | picture_format = [[HDTV]] | runtime = 41 minutes | country = United States | language = English | network = [[The CW]] | executive_producer = [[Tom Welling]]
Kevin Murphy
[[Allan Arkush]] | company = [[CBS Television Studios]]
[[Warner Bros. Television]]
Five & Dime Productions | distributor = [[Warner Bros. Television Distribution]] | location = [[Vancouver]], [[British Columbia]], Canada | first_aired = {{Start date|2010|9|8}} | last_aired = {{End date|2011|5|17}} | num_seasons = 1 | num_episodes = 22 | list_episodes = #Episodes | website = http://www.cwtv.com/shows/hellcats }} '''''Hellcats''''' is an American [[cheerleading]] [[drama]] television series that originally aired on [[The CW]] in the United States from September 8, 2010, to May 17, 2011. Based on the book ''Cheer: Inside the Secret World of College Cheerleaders'' by journalist Kate Torgovnick,{{cite web |url= http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118009678.html |title= Kevin Murphy joins 'Caprica{{'-}} |last= Schneider |first= Michael |date= October 7, 2009 |work= [[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |accessdate= May 13, 2010}} the series focuses in the lives of college cheerleaders, mainly Marti Perkins ([[Aly Michalka]]), a pre-law college student who has to join the cheerleading team, the Hellcats, in order to get the athletic scholarship she needs. The main cast also includes [[Ashley Tisdale]], [[Robbie Jones (actor)|Robbie Jones]], [[Heather Hemmens]], [[Matt Barr]], [[Gail O'Grady]], and [[Sharon Leal]]. In May 2010, ''Hellcats'' had been picked by [[The CW]] for the fall 2010–11 season.[http://www.cwtvpr.com/the-cw/releases/view?id=39346 THE CW ANNOUNCES 2010-2011 SCHEDULE]{{Cite news|title=Life Unexpected, One Tree Hill Renewed; Nikita, Hellcats Picked Up By CW |last=Gorman |first=Bill |url=http://tvbythenumbers.com/2010/05/18/life-unexpected-one-tree-hill-renewed-nikita-hellcats-picked-up-by-cw/51741 |date=May 18, 2010 |work=TV by the Numbers |accessdate=May 18, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100521030419/http://tvbythenumbers.com/2010/05/18/life-unexpected-one-tree-hill-renewed-nikita-hellcats-picked-up-by-cw/51741 |archivedate=May 21, 2010 |df= }}{{Cite news|title=The CW Announces 2010-2011 Schedule |url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2010/05/20/the-cw-announces-2010-2011-schedule/20100520cw01/ |date=April 14, 2010 |work=[[The CW Television Network]]|publisher=The Futon Critic|accessdate=May 20, 2010}} Initially with a 13-episode order, The CW aired the series after ''[[America's Next Top Model]]'' on Wednesday nights. The pilot episode aired on September 8, 2010, and became the first premiere to ever match or build on an ''America's Next Top Model'' lead-in since The CW began in 2006. The CW later gave a full season order for the series, with executives saying they were "thrilled that it paid off for us". On May 17, 2011, The CW announced that ''Hellcats'' would not be renewed for the 2011 fall schedule.{{Cite news|title=The CW Renews One Tree Hill and Nikita, Cancels Hellcats |url=http://www.tvguide.com/news/Tree-Hill-Nikita-Renewed-1033215.aspx|last=Stanhope|first=Kate|date=May 17, 2011 |work=[[TV Guide]] |accessdate=May 17, 2011}} ''Hellcats'' has been described as "''[[Election (1999 film)|Election]]'' meets ''[[Bring It On (film)|Bring It On]]''" by critics.{{Cite news|title=Pilot intel: CW orders Tom Welling-produced drama |url=http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2010/02/02/pilot-intel-cw-tom-welling-hellcats/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100205044048/http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2010/02/02/pilot-intel-cw-tom-welling-hellcats/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=February 5, 2010 |last=Ausiello |first=Michael |date=February 2, 2010 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]] |accessdate=April 4, 2010 }}{{Cite news|title=CW Greenlights BETWIXT Pilot; Gives Presentation Orders to HMS and HELLCATS |url=http://www.collider.com/2010/02/03/cw-greenlights-betwixt-pilot-gives-presentation-orders-to-hms-and-hellcats/ |last=Corbin|first=David|date=February 3, 2010 |work=Collider |accessdate=April 4, 2010}} It received mixed reviews during its first season, obtaining a Metacritic weighted average score of 51 percent, based on the impression of 22 critics. The series also earned a nomination in the 2011 [[37th People's Choice Awards|People's Choice Awards]]. ==Series overview== ''Hellcats'' follows Marti Perkins, a pre-law college student at Lancer University, who lost her scholarship and has no other choice but to join the college's cheer squad, the Hellcats, in order to obtain a new one. There she meets her new roommate and team captain Savannah Monroe, the injured flyer Alice Verdura, her new partner Lewis Flynn and the Hellcats coach Vanessa Lodge who hopes to win nationals, otherwise the cheer leading program will be cut. All the while, Marti also has to deal with her financially unstable and sometimes irresponsible mother, Wanda Perkins, whom she often has to bail out of difficult situations, and her best friend Dan Patch. ==Cast and characters== [[File:Hellcats.PNG|thumb|left|The main cast of ''Hellcats''; from left to right: Heather Hemmens, Matt Barr, Aly Michalka, Robbie Jones, and Ashley Tisdale]] *Marti Perkins ([[Aly Michalka]]) is the protagonist of the series and a townie from Memphis, Tennessee. Described as "wicked smart", she is a pre-law student at Lancer University. Her mother, Wanda Perkins ([[Gail O'Grady]]), works at the university pub and is a party girl who never grew up. Her mother's behavior is, for the most part, an embarrassment to Marti. When Lancer's administrative department cuts scholarships for Lancer employees and families, Marti learns she can get a new one by choosing one of Lancer's programs. She then auditions for a position on Lancer's cheerleading team, the Hellcats. *Savannah Monroe ([[Ashley Tisdale]]), the captain of the Hellcats, is described as "peppy and petite" with a "fierce intensity". She initially clashes with Marti, but realizes she is the godsend that the Hellcats need to win the championship. She votes for Marti when the team has auditions for a new flyer. Savannah is from a very religious, upper-middle class southern family. After a fight with her family, she left the university she was attending, Memphis Christian, and transferred to secular Lancer. Her sister Charlotte, a recurring role played by [[Emma Lahana]], is the captain of the Cyclones, the cheerleading team at Savannah's old school and a Hellcats' rival. *Alice ([[Heather Hemmens]]) is dangerously [[narcissistic]] and after she injures her wrist, she dislikes the idea of Marti replacing her on the squad, or the attention Marti receives from Alice's ex-boyfriend, Lewis Flynn. *Lewis ([[Robbie Jones (actor)|Robbie Jones]]) is one of the Hellcats' bases and is an easy-going guy who has a love for action. He was once a star on the Lancer football team but quit when he discovered a scandal of players being paid by the college. He tried out for the Hellcats team when his then-girlfriend Alice encouraged him to do so in order to gain scholarship money after the football scandal, and instantly became hooked. He has an instant attraction to Marti. They later start dating. *Dan Patch ([[Matt Barr]]) is a townie who is Marti's friend. He had an unspoken crush on her but now is dating Savannah, Marti's new friend on the team. He's of Irish descent with at least six siblings. *Vanessa Lodge ([[Sharon Leal]]) is a former Hellcat cheerleader who is now the team's coach. Her job is threatened if the Hellcats do not place at the national competition. *Supporting cast includes Red Raymond ([[Jeff Hephner]]), the Lancer's football coach who shares a romantic past with Vanessa, and Derrick Altman ([[D. B. Woodside]]), a doctor who works at Lancer University and is now Vanessa's boyfriend. Bill Marsh ([[Aaron Douglas (actor)|Aaron Douglas]]) is the college's athletic director who is still involved in a "pay for play" scandal with players that could get the school's programs (including the Hellcats) suspended. Morgan Pepper (Craig Anderson) is a pre-law student and Marti's classmate. He later befriends Marti and joins her to solve a legal case introduced by their teacher Julian ([[Gale Harold]]). Other Hellcats members include Darwin (Jeremy Wong), and Frankie (Alana Randall). Kathy ([[Magda Apanowicz]]) is a member of the Cyclones, usually called "Nasty Kathy". ==Production== ===Development=== {{Quote box |quote="Through that book we were able to understand that there was a whole world here that hadn't been tapped into and Kevin Murphy was able to go in and bring it to life and create this universe for these characters. I just think it's a great story. I think there's a lot of heart. I think there's a lot of struggle for all of our characters, especially our lead and her journey and her finding her identity and what she's going to do with her life. I just found that interesting." |source=—[[Tom Welling]]{{Cite news| last=Fernandez|first=Maria Elena| work = [[Los Angeles Times]]| title =TCA Press Tour: Superman takes on cheerleading in the CW's 'Hellcats{{'-}} | date = July 29, 2010 | url = http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/showtracker/2010/07/tca-press-tour-hellcats-1.html | accessdate=July 30, 2010}} |width=215px |align=left |salign =right |qalign=left}} ''Hellcats'' is based on the book ''Cheer: Inside the Secret World of College Cheerleaders'' by journalist Kate Torgovnick and the series has been described as "''[[Election (1999 film)|Election]]'' meets ''[[Bring It On (film)|Bring It On]]''".{{Cite news|title=New shows eye slots |url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118015545.html |date=February 21, 2010 |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |last=Kissell|first=Rick|accessdate=April 4, 2010}} Actor [[Tom Welling]] teamed with [[Kevin Murphy (screenwriter)|Kevin Murphy]] to executive produce the series, which was initially given the name ''Cheer''.{{cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/CW-Renewals-Pickups-1018613.aspx|title=CW Renews One Tree Hill, Life Unexpected; Cancels "Melrose"; Picks Up Two Series|last=Eng|first=Joyce|date=May 18, 2010|publisher=TVGuide.com}}{{Cite news |title=CW renews 'Smallville' for 10th season |url= http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118016111.html |date= March 4, 2010 |last= Schneider |first= Michael |work= [[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |accessdate= April 4, 2010}}{{Cite news|title=Pilot Season: First look at CW's 2010 pilots |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/showtracker/2010/02/pilot-season-first-look-at-cws-2010-pilots.html|last=Fernandez|first=Maria Elena |date=February 24, 2010 |work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|accessdate=April 5, 2010}} The [[Television pilot|pilot episode]] was written by Murphy{{Cite news |title= U.S. networks turn to Israel |url= http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118014602.html |date= February 2, 2010 |last= Schneider |first= Michael |work= [[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |accessdate= April 4, 2010}} and directed by [[Allan Arkush]]. On May 18, 2010, ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'', ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' and ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' reported that [[The CW]] had picked up the series for the 2010–2011 television season and confirmed that [[Paul Becker]] would be the head choreographer for the series.{{Cite news|title=CW picks up 'Nikita,' 'Hellcats,' 'Life,' 'OTH{{'-}} |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/blogs/live-feed/cw-picks-nikita-hellcats-life-53671|last=Hibberd|first=James|date=May 18, 2010 |work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=December 4, 2010}}{{Cite news|title=Breaking: CW renews 'One Tree Hill' and 'Life Unexpected{{'-}} |url=http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2010/05/18/cw-renews-one-tree-hill-life-unexpected/ |last=Ausiello |first=Michael |date=May 18, 2010 |work=Entertainment Weekly |accessdate=May 18, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100520031623/http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2010/05/18/cw-renews-one-tree-hill-life-unexpected/ |archivedate=May 20, 2010 |df= }}{{Cite news|title="LIFE UNEXPECTED," "ONE TREE HILL" MAKE THE CUT AT THE CW |url=http://thefutoncritic.com/news/2010/05/18/life-unexpected-one-tree-hill-make-the-cut-at-the-cw/8690/|date=May 18, 2010 |work=Futon Critic|accessdate=May 18, 2010}}{{Cite news |title= CW renews 'Life,' 'One Tree Hill{{'-}} |url= http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118019539.html |date= May 18, 2010 |last= Schneider |first= Michael |work= [[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |accessdate= May 18, 2010}} Tisdale's character was originally named Sierra Sloan but was renamed Savannah Monroe in the press release. While presenting its 2010–11 season schedule on May 21, 2010, [[The CW]] officially confirmed the pick up of the series and announced its intention to air ''Hellcats'' after ''[[America's Next Top Model]]'' on Wednesday nights.{{Cite news|title=Breaking: The CW's new fall schedule |url=http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2010/05/20/the-cws-new-fall-schedule/ |last=Ausiello |first=Michael |date=May 20, 2010 |work=Entertainment Weekly |accessdate=May 20, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100523002810/http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2010/05/20/the-cws-new-fall-schedule/ |archivedate=May 23, 2010 |df= }} ''[[TV Guide]]'' reported that Ashley Tisdale is the best paid of the cast, earning $30,000 per episode during the first season of the series.{{Cite news|title=Who Are TV's Top Earners? |url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Top-TV-Earners-1021717.aspx#BLKcommentCount|publisher=[[TV Guide]]|date=August 11, 2010|last=Battaglio|first=Stephen|accessdate=August 11, 2010}} During the 2010 [[Television Critics Association]] press tour in Los Angeles on July 29, 2010, producer Murphy said the series "was inspired by aspirational sports movies of the 1980s like ''[[Breaking Away]]'', ''[[Vision Quest]]'', and Pittsburgh-set ''[[Flashdance]]''", and also added that "''Hellcats'' is a show either for optimists or for people who are interested in learning the trade".{{Cite news|title=PRESS TOUR JOURNAL: CW cheers for 'Hellcats |url=http://communityvoices.sites.post-gazette.com/index.php/arts-entertainment-living/tuned-in-journal/24329-press-tour-journal-cw-cheers-for-hellcats |last=Own|first=Bob|date=July 29, 2010 |work=[[Pittsburgh Post-Gazette]]|accessdate=July 29, 2010}} Producer Welling said he was attracted to the series mainly because of the script, and he also felt the cheerleaders' world had not yet been tapped into on television.{{Cite news|title=Ashley Tisdale and Aly Michalka Cheer on 'Hellcats' - TCA Report|url=http://www.tvsquad.com/2010/07/30/ashley-tisdale-and-aly-michalka-cheer-on-hellcats-tca-recap/ |last=Prudom|first=Laura|date=July 30, 2010 |work=[[TV Squad]]|accessdate=July 30, 2010}} When asked why it picked up ''Hellcats'', The CW replied saying the series is "one of the underdogs" and it liked the big production numbers.{{Cite news|title=The CW talks 'Vampire Diaries,' 'Nikita,' 'Hellcats': Live from TCA press tour|url=http://blog.zap2it.com/frominsidethebox/2010/07/the-cw-talks-vampire-diaries-nikita-hellcats-live-from-tca-press-tour.html|last=Nguyen|first=Hanh|date=July 29, 2010|work=Zap2It|accessdate=July 29, 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100801130759/http://blog.zap2it.com/frominsidethebox/2010/07/the-cw-talks-vampire-diaries-nikita-hellcats-live-from-tca-press-tour.html|archivedate=August 1, 2010|df=}} The filming of the pilot episode took place in [[Vancouver|Vancouver, British Columbia]], Canada between April 13–21, 2010.{{Cite news|title=Arkush Cheers On Welling's "Hellcats"|url=http://www.vancouverfilm.net/2010/04/arkush-cheers-on-wellings-hellcats.html |date=April 24, 2010 |work=Vancouver Film|accessdate=April 25, 2010}} The filming of the next episodes of the first season began on July 14 in Vancouver.{{Cite news|title=FIRST LOOK - NEW HELLCATS STILLS |url=http://www.ashleytisdale.com/news/2010/05/20/first-look-new-hellcats-stills |date=May 20, 2010 |publisher=Warner Bros. Records|accessdate=May 20, 2010}} {{Dead link|date=April 2012|bot=H3llBot}} The cast had two weeks of rehearsal for the pilot episode but after the series' fall season pick up, they will only have a week to rehearse the dance numbers for each episode. Former ''[[Fame (1982 TV series)|Fame]]'' actress and choreographer [[Debbie Allen]] directed the episode "Pledging My Love".{{Cite news|title=Dancing Queen Debbie Allen to direct Hellcats episode. |url=http://www.wetpaint.com/hellcats/articles/dancing-queen-debbie-allen-to-direct-hellcats-episode |date=September 23, 2010 |publisher=Wet Paint|accessdate=May 24, 2010}} The CW Network attempted to break the [[Guinness World Records]] mark for the "Largest Cheerleading Dance" at a single venue by inviting cheerleading squads to participate in a five-minute choreographed ''Hellcats'' dance in September 2010.{{Cite news|title=The CW Network Is Bringing ''Hellcats'' to the Heart of Frisco, TX For the Largest Cheerleading Event The Nation Has Ever Seen|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2010/09/03/the-cw-network-is-bringing-hellcats-to-the-heart-of-frisco-tx-for-the-largest-cheerleading-event-the-nation-has-ever-seen/20100903cw01/#ixzz0yhhHaQgu |work=Futon Critic|date=September 3, 2010 |accessdate=September 5, 2010}} The mark was not broken as there were not enough cheerleaders present.{{Cite news|title=Cheerleaders fall short of record but display spirit, enthusiasm|url=http://www.dallasnews.com/sharedcontent/dws/news/city/collin/frisco/stories/DN-cheerrecord_05met.ART.East.Edition1.35894a6.html |last=Hacker|first=Holly|work=[[The Dallas Morning News]]|date=September 5, 2010 |accessdate=September 5, 2010}} ===Casting=== [[File:Emmazcamera187-2 crop.jpg|thumb|upright|right|On why he cast Tisdale, Murphy said she can "hold multiple colors in the same palette."]] On March 8, 2010, ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' announced that Aly Michalka and Gail O'Grady were the first actresses to be cast in the series.{{Cite news|title={{-'}}Almost Famous' star joins ABC comedy pilot |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/almost-famous-star-joins-abc-21384|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|date=March 8, 2010 |work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=December 4, 2010}} Michalka would play the lead role of Marti Perkins, a college girl who decided to join the ''Hellcats'', and O'Grady was to portray Wanda Perkins, Marti's mother.{{Cite news|title=Ashley Tisdale to co-star in 'Hellcats{{'-}} |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/ashley-tisdale-co-star-hellcats-21767 |last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|date=March 18, 2010 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |accessdate=April 4, 2010}} The site later announced that actress Ashley Tisdale was cast as Savannah Monroe (then known as Sierra Sloane), the fiercely intense captain of the Hellcats.{{Cite news|title=Ashley Tisdale joins CW pilot about cheerleaders |url=http://hollywoodinsider.ew.com/2010/03/18/ashley-tisdale-cw-hellcats/ |last=Rice |first=Lynette |date=March 18, 2010 |work=Entertainment Weekly |accessdate=April 4, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100323012117/http://hollywoodinsider.ew.com/2010/03/18/ashley-tisdale-cw-hellcats/ |archivedate=March 23, 2010 |df= }} Matt Barr was cast as Dan Patch, a womanizer who quietly pines for Marti.{{Cite news|title=Development Update: Monday, March 29|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news.aspx?id=8595 |date=March 29, 2010 |work=The Futon Critic|accessdate=April 4, 2010}} On April 5, 2010, it was reported that actors Robbie Jones and Heather Hemmens were cast. Jones would portray the male lead, a cheerleading "base" who falls for Marti, and Hemmens to play a cheerleader sidelined with a wrist injury.{{Cite news|title=Chad Lowe joins ABC Family series |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/content_display/news/e3i5aa07fe16321f4393af284d8f5215325 |date=April 1, 2010 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|accessdate=December 4, 2010}}{{Cite news |title= CW adds Hemmens to 'Hellcats' |url= http://weblogs.variety.com/on_the_air/2010/04/cw-adds-hemmens-to-hellcats.html |date= April 5, 2010 |work= Variety |last= Levine |first= Stuart |accessdate= May 18, 2010 |deadurl= yes |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20120716081439/http://weblogs.variety.com/on_the_air/2010/04/cw-adds-hemmens-to-hellcats.html |archivedate= July 16, 2012 |df= }} On April 8, 2010, it was reported that actress Sharon Leal was cast as Vanessa Lodge, a former Hellcat star who now serves as the squad's coach.{{Cite news|title=Development Update: Friday, April 9|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2010/04/09/development-update-friday-april-9/8612/ |date=April 9, 2010 |work=The Futon Critic|accessdate=April 9, 2010}}{{Cite news|title=Mare Winningham joins HBO's 'Pierce{{'-}} |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/content_display/news/e3i25d5a034c5bd6dc5ad8cf0e3dad98fd4 |last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|date=April 8, 2010 |work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=December 4, 2010}} Elena Esovolva was cast as Patty "The Wedge" Wedgerman, a lesbian cheerleader and a base for the squad.{{cite web|url=http://www.afterellen.com/blog/karmankregloe/hellcats-gets-a-lesbian-cheerleader |title="Hellcats" gets a lesbian cheerleader |last=Kregloe |first=Karman |date=June 23, 2010 |work=After Ellen |accessdate=January 23, 2011 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120718010910/http://www.afterellen.com/blog/karmankregloe/hellcats-gets-a-lesbian-cheerleader |archivedate=July 18, 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }} On April 14, 2010, it was announced that [[Ben Browder]] was cast as Red Raymond, Lancer University's football coach.{{Cite news|title=Development Update: Wednesday, April 14|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2010/04/14/development-update-wednesday-april-14/8620/ |date=April 14, 2010 |work=The Futon Critic|accessdate=April 14, 2010}} On May 21, 2010, it was announced that the role was being recast and possibly retooled as well, although Browder had already shot scenes for the pilot episode.{{Cite news|title=Recastings Come Fast & Furious This Year|url=http://www.deadline.com/2010/05/recastings-come-fast-furious-this-year/ |last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|date=May 21, 2010 |work=Deadline Hollywood|accessdate=May 21, 2010}} Raymond's role was later given to Jeff Hephner.{{Cite news|title=Jeff Hephner to Play Football Coach on Hellcats|url=http://www.tvfanatic.com/2010/07/jeff-hephner-to-play-football-coach-on-hellcats/ |last=House|first=M.L.|date=July 20, 2010 |work=TV Fanatic|accessdate=July 21, 2010}} On July 13, one day before the beginning of filming, D. B. Woodside was cast as Derrick Altman, a "handsome young physician who takes care of the Hellcats cheerleaders".{{Cite news|title={{-'}}Hellcats': '24's' D.B. Woodside joins the squad|url=http://blog.zap2it.com/frominsidethebox/2010/07/hellcats-24s-db-woodside-joins-the-squad.html|last=Adly MacKenzie|first=Carina|date=July 13, 2010|work=Zap2It|accessdate=July 14, 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100716182552/http://blog.zap2it.com/frominsidethebox/2010/07/hellcats-24s-db-woodside-joins-the-squad.html|archivedate=July 16, 2010|df=}} Producer Kevin Murphy confirmed that Gale Harold would guest star in the series as one of Marti's law professors. Michalka added that Harold would appear in the third episode of the first season and had a multiple-episode arc.{{Cite news|title={{-'}}Hellcats' taps 'DH's' Gale Harold as crime-solving law professor|url=http://blog.zap2it.com/frominsidethebox/2010/07/hellcats-taps-dhs-gale-harold-as-crime-solving-law-professor.html|last=Adly MacKenzie|first=Carina|date=July 31, 2010|work=Zap2It|accessdate=July 31, 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100731205533/http://blog.zap2it.com/frominsidethebox/2010/07/hellcats-taps-dhs-gale-harold-as-crime-solving-law-professor.html|archivedate=July 31, 2010|df=}} In late November 2010, [[AJ Michalka]] was cast in a recurring role as a girl who works at a record store near Lancer University and befriends Marti.{{Cite news|title={{-'}}Hellcats': AJ Michalka joins sister Aly for multi-episode arc|url=http://blog.zap2it.com/frominsidethebox/2010/11/hellcats-aj-michalka-joins-sister-aly-for-multi-episode-arc.html|last=Adly MacKenzie|first=Carina|date=November 29, 2010|work=Zap2It|accessdate=November 29, 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101202010425/http://blog.zap2it.com/frominsidethebox/2010/11/hellcats-aj-michalka-joins-sister-aly-for-multi-episode-arc.html|archivedate=December 2, 2010|df=}} [[Camille Sullivan]] was added to the supporting cast in February 2011 to portray Red Reymond's ex-wife.{{Cite news|title=Scoop: Hellcats Recruits a New Villainess!|url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/02/hellcats-casts-camille-sullivan/ |last=Mitovich|first=Matt Webb|date=February 7, 2011 |work=TVLine|accessdate=February 7, 2011}} On January 18, 2011, it was announced that Esovolova would not be returning to the show. Michalka has said that it was difficult for the writers to incorporate her storylines with the others.{{cite web|url=http://www.afterellen.com/TV/2011/01/alyson-michalka-on-marti-savannah-subtext-and-why-hellcats-rid-of-their-lesbian |title=Alyson Michalka on Marti/Savannah subtext and why "Hellcats" got rid of their lesbian |last=Goldberg |first=Lesley |date=January 18, 2011 |work=After Ellen |accessdate=January 23, 2011 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120718003512/http://www.afterellen.com/TV/2011/01/alyson-michalka-on-marti-savannah-subtext-and-why-hellcats-rid-of-their-lesbian |archivedate=July 18, 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }} ===Music=== During the 2010 [[Television Critics Association]] press tour held in Los Angeles on July 29, 2010, lead actresses Michalka and Tisdale were asked about the idea of singing on the show. They stated that they plan to keep their music careers separate from the series, although Michalka advised that she would sing in the fourth episode. In addition to that, Michalka's band [[78violet]] recorded "Belong Here", which served as the theme song for ''Hellcats''. It was later released into digital stores.{{Cite news|title=78Violet will perform Hellcats theme song|publisher=Wet Paint|date=September 7, 2010|url=http://www.wetpaint.com/hellcats/articles/78violet-will-perform-hellcats-theme-song|accessdate=September 18, 2010}} Executive producer [[Kevin Murphy (screenwriter)|Kevin Murphy]] confirmed in an interview that a soundtrack would be released for the series, which would include the theme song and other songs recorded for the series. He later added "So we are building a library of material. Once we have enough, we're gonna put it on iTunes and definitely do a soundtrack album."{{Cite news|title=Hellcats creator Kevin Murphy promises a soundtrack.|publisher=Wet Paint|date=September 17, 2010|url=http://www.wetpaint.com/hellcats/articles/hellcats-music-stay-tuned-for-a-rockin-soundtrack|accessdate=September 18, 2010}} Songs covered for the series include "[[The Letter (The Box Tops song)|The Letter]]"{{Cite news|title=Hellcats Music: Episode 1.05|publisher=The CW|url=http://www.cwtv.com/music/hellcats/season-1/episode-105|accessdate=January 3, 2011}} originally by [[The Box Tops]], [[Sting (musician)|Sting]]'s "[[Brand New Day (Sting album)|Brand New Day]]",{{Cite news|title=Hellcats Music: Episode 1.04|publisher=The CW|url=http://www.cwtv.com/music/hellcats/season-1/episode-10|accessdate=January 3, 2011}} [[Squeeze (band)|Squeeze]]'s "[[Tempted (Squeeze song)|Tempted]]" and [[The Go-Go's]] hit "[[We Got the Beat]]".{{Cite news|title=Hellcats Music: Episode 1.08|publisher=The CW|url=http://www.cwtv.com/music/hellcats/season-1/episode-108|accessdate=January 14, 2011}} Canadian singer [[Fefe Dobson]] recorded "Rockstar", an exclusive song for the series that was played during the "[[A World Full of Strangers]]" episode. "Rockstar" was ultimately released on the [[iTunes]] Deluxe Edition of Dobson's album ''[[Joy (Fefe Dobson album)|Joy]]''. As previously promised by Murphy, a digital [[Extended play|EP]] featuring five of the songs recorded for the series was released on November 30, 2010, via Warner Bros. Records.{{Cite news|title=Hellcats (Music from the Television Series) - EP by Various Artists|publisher=Apple|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/preorder/hellcats-music-from-television/id405339365|accessdate=November 24, 2010}} The first season of ''Hellcats'' also included live performances by guest musicians, including [[Hey Monday]], [[Faber Drive]], [[Fefe Dobson]], [[3OH!3]] featuring [[Ashley Tisdale]],{{Cite news|title=Wetpaint Exclusive: Ashley Tisdale Dishes On the Danger of Cheerleading|publisher=Wet Paint|date=December 30, 2010|url=http://www.wetpaint.com/hellcats/articles/wetpaint-exclusive-ashley-tisdale-dishes-on-the-dangers-of-cheerleading|accessdate=December 31, 2010}} [[Elise Estrada]] and [[Ciara]].{{Cite news|title='Hellcats' first look: Ciara performs 'Gimme Dat,' makes Robbie Jones swoon|publisher=Zap2it.com|date=May 3, 2011|url=http://blog.zap2it.com/frominsidethebox/2011/05/hellcats-first-look-ciara-performs-gimme-dat-makes-robbie-jones-swoon.html|accessdate=May 3, 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110507030125/http://blog.zap2it.com/frominsidethebox/2011/05/hellcats-first-look-ciara-performs-gimme-dat-makes-robbie-jones-swoon.html|archivedate=May 7, 2011|df=}} ==Episodes== The first and only season of ''Hellcats'' consisted of 22 episodes. The [[A World Full of Strangers|pilot episode]] was broadcast on September 8, 2010. The initial order for the series was thirteen episodes.{{Cite news|title=Hellcats On The CW - TheFutonCritic.com |url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/showatch/hellcats/|publisher=The Futon Critic|accessdate=June 17, 2010}} On September 23, 2010, due to successful ratings, [[The CW]] ordered six more scripts for the first season, although its production order was still at thirteen.{{cite web|url=http://uk.eonline.com/uberblog/watch_with_kristin/b202088_thank_you_cw_more_one_tree_hill.html#ixzz10OwUyuHu |title=Thank You, CW! More One Tree Hill & Hellcats On the Way|date=September 23, 2010|last=Masters|first=Megan|work=E!Online|accessdate=September 24, 2010}}{{Cite news|title=Rookie 'Hellcats' & Veteran 'One Tree Hill' Get Additional Scripts At CW|url=http://www.deadline.com/2010/09/rookie-hellcats-veteran-one-tree-hill-get-additional-scripts/ |last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|date=September 23, 2010 |work=Deadline|accessdate=September 23, 2010}}{{Cite news|title=The CW orders more 'Hellcats,' 'One Tree Hill' scripts|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/blogs/live-feed/cw-orders-hellcats-tree-hill-54550 |last=Hibberd|first=James|date=September 23, 2010 |work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=December 4, 2010}} On October 22, 2010, ''Variety'' announced that The CW had given a full season order for the series. The network said they took risks this year but they were "thrilled that they've paid off for us".{{Cite news|title=The CW picks up 'Nikita', 'Hellcats{{'-}} |url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118026194.html?categoryid=4076&cs=1 |last=Littleton|first=Cynthia|date=October 22, 2010 |work=Variety|accessdate=October 22, 2010}} ''Hellcats'' aired on Wednesdays at 9–10 pm until December 1, 2010, when the eleventh episode aired. Starting January 25, 2011, The CW moved ''Hellcats'' to Tuesday nights at 9–10 pm, following ''[[One Tree Hill (TV series)|One Tree Hill]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.deadline.com/2010/12/cw-unveils-midseason-schedule-hellcats-moves-to-tuesdays/|title=CW Unveils Midseason Schedule, 'Hellcats' Moves To Tuesdays|first=Nellie|last=Andreeva|date=December 13, 2010|work=Deadline.com|accessdate=December 14, 2010}} {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width: 100%; margin-right: 0;" |- ! style="background:#03c; color:#fff;"| No. ! style="background:#03c; color:#fff;"| Title ! style="background:#03c; color:#fff;"| Directed by ! style="background:#03c; color:#fff;"| Written by ! style="background:#03c; color:#fff;"| Original air date ! style="background:#03c; color:#fff;"| Production
code ! style="background:#03c; color:#fff;"| U.S. viewers

Bourgy. September 14, 2010. Retrieved October 31, 2010. |ShortSummary = In order to gain a scholarship and stay in school, pre-law student Marti Perkins tries out for the cheerleading squad. She eventually makes it by becoming friends with Savannah Monroe, the head cheerleader. Marti does not get along with Alice Verdura, the cheerleader she replaced in the squad after a bad injury, but finds a fast friend in one of the Hellcats bases, Lewis Flynn. |LineColor = 0033CC }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 2 |Title = I Say a Little Prayer |DirectedBy = Allan Arkush |WrittenBy = {{StoryTeleplay|s= Kevin Murphy|t= Kevin Murphy & [[Jennifer Schuur]]}} |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2010|9|15}} |ProdCode = 2J5552 |Aux4 = 2.64{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.com/2010/09/16/survivor-outlaw/63866 |title='Survivor' & 'Big Brother' Rise in Finals; 'Outlaw' Falls |work=TV by the Numbers |date=September 16, 2010 |last=Seidman |first=Robert |accessdate=September 16, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100918093601/http://tvbythenumbers.com/2010/09/16/survivor-outlaw/63866 |archivedate=September 18, 2010 |df= }} |ShortSummary = Marti realizes that Wanda is in the audience during qualifiers and banishes her from the stadium. Savannah must choose to stay and compete with the Hellcats or join her sister Charlotte who fell and injured herself when she was competing for the Hellcats' rival Memphis Christian College squad. The Hellcats arrange to switch places with another team, so they can postpone the competition and Savannah may be with her sister. Savannah leaves to take care of her sister though her sister does not welcome her pleasantly and her mother ignores her presence. Marti decides no to tell Wanda about her competition being postponed so she wouldn't assist. Savannah's mom invites her to a praying circle for Charlotte's health but it's the same time of the competition. Savannah confides in Marti about her uptight Christian parents disowning her because of her choice in transferring from Memphis Christian to the secular Lancer University; Marti confides in Savannah that in the past her mother's presence also tenses her up and makes her lose her concentration (the reason she failed in a past gymnastics competition). Savannah competes (after saying a prayer to God for her family and her sister). Wanda shows up, though Marti initially begins to kick her out, she realizes her mom only assists because she is proud of her and decides to let Wanda stay. In the end, Marti is able to perform even with her mother's presence and The Hellcats win the competition. |LineColor = 0033CC }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 3 |Title = Beale St. After Dark |DirectedBy = [[Bethany Rooney]] |WrittenBy = {{StoryTeleplay|s= Kevin Murphy|t= Kevin Murphy & Peter Calloway}} |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2010|9|22}} |ProdCode = 2J5553 |Aux4 = 2.32{{cite web|url=http://www.quotenmeter.de/cms/?p1=n&p2=44754&p3= |title=J.J Abrams’ neue Serie "Undercovers" enttäuscht |work=Quotenmeter.de|date=September 23, 2010 |last=Richter|first=Christian|accessdate=November 6, 2010}} |ShortSummary = Savannah goes on a date with Dan and asks Marti and the rest of the squad to accompany her. Things get messy when Lewis spots Alice taking steroids from Lancer's star quarterback. When Lewis confronts Alice about it, a fight breaks out between the quarterback, Lewis and Dan (Dan was defending Savannah after she was pushed down while trying to break up the fight). The three are sent to jail, however, the football-fan sheriff lets the quarterback go. Lewis is worried he might lose his scholarship so Savannah and Marti turn to Marti's law teacher to get the boys out in time. Meanwhile, Vanessa finally reveals to Derrick that she once had a relationship with Red. |LineColor = 0033CC }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 4 |Title = Nobody Loves Me But My Mother |DirectedBy = [[David Paymer]] |WrittenBy = [[Anne Kenney]] |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2010|9|29}} |ProdCode = 2J5554 |Aux4 = 2.22{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.com/2010/09/30/wednesday-finals-better-with-you-the-middle-modern-family-survivor-law-cougar-town-whole-truth-adjusted-down/65978 |title=Wednesday Finals: ''Better With You'', ''The Middle'', ''Modern Family'', ''Survivor'', ''Law & Order: SVU'', ''Law & Order: LA'' Adjusted Up; ''Cougar Town'', ''Whole Truth'' Adjusted Down |work=TV by the Numbers |last=Gorman |first=Bill |date=September 30, 2010 |accessdate=October 1, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101002104015/http://tvbythenumbers.com/2010/09/30/wednesday-finals-better-with-you-the-middle-modern-family-survivor-law-cougar-town-whole-truth-adjusted-down/65978 |archivedate=October 2, 2010 |df= }} |ShortSummary = Lewis asks Marti out but she rejects him. Also, Derrick punches Red after saying that he has returned to Lancer to get back Vanessa. |LineColor = 0033CC }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 6 |Title = Ragged Old Flag |DirectedBy = [[Kevin Fair]] |WrittenBy = James Eagan |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2010|10|13}} |ProdCode = 2J5556 |Aux4 = 2.01{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.com/2010/10/14/wednesday-finals-survivor-middle-modern-family-l-2020-undercovers-down/68066 |title=Wednesday Finals: ''Survivor'', ''Middle'', ''Modern Family'', ''L&O:SVU'', ''Top Model'' Adjusted Up; ''20/20'', ''Undercovers'' Down |work=TV by the Numbers |last=Seidman |first=Robert |date=October 14, 2010 |accessdate=October 15, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101017055912/http://tvbythenumbers.com/2010/10/14/wednesday-finals-survivor-middle-modern-family-l-2020-undercovers-down/68066 |archivedate=October 17, 2010 |df= }} |ShortSummary = Lewis coaches the Hellcats cheerleaders in a flag football game against the girls volleyball team. Marti and Lewis share an intimate moment. |LineColor = 0033CC }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber = 7 |Title = The Match Game |DirectedBy = [[John Dahl]] |WrittenBy = Jennifer Schuur |OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2010|10|27}} |ProdCode = 2J5557 |Aux4 = 2.03{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.com/2010/10/28/wednesday-finals-survivor-nicaragua-the-middle-adjusted-up-the-whole-truth-down/70055 |title=Wednesday Finals: ''Survivor: Nicaragua'', ''The Middle'' Adjusted Up; ''The Whole Truth'' Down |last=Gorman |first=Bill |work=TV by the Numbers |date=October 28, 2010 |accessdate=October 28, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101030101148/http://tvbythenumbers.com/2010/10/28/wednesday-finals-survivor-nicaragua-the-middle-adjusted-up-the-whole-truth-down/70055 |archivedate=October 30, 2010 |df= }} |ShortSummary = The Hellcats plan a date auction so they can raise funds to get them to Nationals, but things go awry after Savannah's old boyfriend, Noah, shows up. Desperate to stop Charlotte from "flying" in their cheer leading routine, Savannah commits herself to being the flier in Charlotte's place.
